page.title: 07Sharlston Dam (Poem)
page.content: The water sparkles like a diamond It looks just like a mirror The swans are swimming round and round Following wherever you go The mini estuary next to the Dam With clear water floating down The beautiful bluebells in the wood The Canadian Pondweed is greeny-brown The paths are dry and dusty The cuckoo singing in the tree The crackling and crunching of the leaves Litter and plastic bags thrown about Making the dam look untidy The gorse bush with its yellow flowers Looking bright in the sun The reeds peeping through the water They are just beginning to grow The sun sets and the moon appears And the Dam glistens in the moonlight.
